brief_title: Time series of global gene expression after trivalent influenza vaccination in humans
condition_studied: Humoral immune response to influenza vaccination
description: The relationship between gene expression patterns and humoral immune response to vaccination was analyzed in order to understand the interindividual variability among immune reponse to vaccination
endpoints: 1) Global transcript abundance in peripheral blood RNA specimens 2) Type-specific antibody measurements (H1N1, H3N2, and FluB) in serum samples
hypothesis: An integrated, systematic evaluation of the transcriptional response to influenza vaccination using multiple time points and incorporating antibody response data  has the potential to be an effective method for identifying loci that influence vaccine responsiveness and subsequent immunity to influenza in humans.
objectives: To identify specific gene variants reponsible for influencing vaccine response
official_title: Time series of global gene expression after trivalent influenza vaccination in humans
